title: Operation Manager
job_overview:
About Us
We’re an Australian trade-services group with three fast-growing divisions—cleaning & care, steel fabrication, and multi-trade maintenance. Across all units we share one priority: smooth, reliable operations that let our field teams shine. To keep projects moving and clients happy, we’re hiring one versatile Admin & Operations Professional to become the digital backbone of our day-to-day work. You’ll report directly to the business owners, work shoulder-to-shoulder with site supervisors, and own the systems that keep jobs, documents, and dollars in sync.

Key Responsibilities
- Client communication: Answer and route calls, triage inboxes, and handle routine enquiries with a friendly, “right-first-time” approach.
- Scheduling & coordination: Book jobs, confirm appointments, and keep shared calendars and task boards current so crews know exactly where to be.
- Documentation & file control: Build clear folder structures, enforce version control, and keep Google Drive tidy and searchable.
- Invoicing & basic bookkeeping: Raise and track invoices, maintain billing records, and liaise with our bookkeeper to ensure clean month-end close.
- Workflow optimisation: Spot bottlenecks, set up light automations (e.g., Zapier), and propose process tweaks that save hours each week.
- Team support & reporting: Provide concise status updates, maintain simple KPI dashboards, and keep everyone aligned on priorities.

What You’ll Bring
- 3–5 years of solid admin/operations experience, ideally within construction, trades, or service businesses.
- Confident with Google Workspace, VOIP phone systems, Xero (or similar), and basic automation tools like Zapier.
- Eagle-eye for detail, natural systems thinker, and a proactive communicator who owns outcomes end-to-end.
- Comfortable working remotely, balancing independent focus with real-time collaboration during AEST business hours.

Tools & Software You’ll Use
- Google Workspace & Drive – day-to-day documents, shared folders, version control
- Google Calendar – job and crew scheduling
- Xero – invoicing, reconciliation, month-end close
- Invoice Simple – quick invoice generation for smaller jobs
- Fergus (or similar job-tracking platform) – track work orders and site progress
- Ascorer / task-management software – keep tasks visible and on target
- Zapier – build light automations that eliminate double-handling
- VOIP / Softphone system – handle inbound and outbound calls from anywhere
